intro: Lomatia silaifolia f. pinnata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved lomatia, is a shrub native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its finely divided, pinnate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is found in regions with a Mediterranean climate. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
